intro: Lithocarpus auriculatus, commonly known as the golden cup oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The plant is characterized by its leathery, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its fruit is a hard, woody nut enclosed in a cupule, which is a unique feature of the genus Lithocarpus. This plant is often found in tropical and subtropical forests, growing in well-drained soils and thriving in humid climates.
